learning_outcomes.description: Articulate the logic and benefits of advanced quantitative social science research
Interpret advanced quantitative analyses in published academic and non-academic research outputs
Review and critique advanced quantitative analyses done by others
Identify the appropriate regression model for analysing continuous or categorical data
Appreciate conceptual differences between confounding, moderation and mediation
Use statistical software to access, manage and manipulate survey data in preparation for quantitative analyses
Use statistical software to undertake bivariate and multiple linear and logistic regression models
Access and manage data according to the principles of responsible data use
Understand core concepts and tools for causal inference
Gain familiarity with advanced study designs for multilevel, longitudinal, and experimental/quasi-experimental research.

assessments.task_description:
A computer and statistical assignment worth 30% of the overall course grade. This assignment will be placed on Blackboard in Week 2 and will be completed in a three-week period (weeks 2, 3, and 4). The assignment will pose a series of separate questions that with cover the material covered in the lectures and lab sessions. There is no strict word limit for this assignment, but it is expected that students' combined responses will be no longer than 1,000 words (excluding Stata output, tables, graphs, and Stata log files).

Marking criteria and/or marking rubrics are available in the ‘Assessment’ folder in Blackboard for this course.

AI use: This assessment task evaluates student’s abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of Artificial Intelligence (AI). Students are advised that the use of AI technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You must submit your assignment electronically by the due time, on the due date.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
A computer and statistical assignment worth 35% of the overall course grade. This assignment will be placed on Blackboard in Week 7 and will be completed in a three-week period (weeks 7, 8, and 9). The assignment will pose a series of separate questions that with cover the material covered in the lectures and lab sessions. There is no strict word limit for this assignment, but it is expected that students' combined responses will be no longer than 1,000 words (excluding Stata output, tables, graphs, and Stata log files).

Marking criteria and/or marking rubrics are available in the ‘Assessment’ folder in Blackboard for this course.

AI use: This assessment task evaluates student’s abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of Artificial Intelligence (AI). Students are advised that the use of AI technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Your assignment must be submitted via Turnitin on blackboard. To submit your assignment electronically log in to http://learn.uq.edu.au/ with your UQ username and password, then click on Course Code>>Assessment>>Assignments, and use the appropriate assignment submission link for each piece of assessment. No e-mailed submissions of assessments will be accepted.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.topic:
Course introduction (Week 1)

This lecture will introduce the course. Among others, it will cover the course structure, the objectives, the recommended readings, and the assessment.

Learning outcomes: L01
learning_activities.topic_description: Course introduction (Week 1) This lecture will introduce the course. Among others, it will cover the course structure, the objectives, the recommended readings, and the assessment.

learning_activities.topic:
Lab session (Week 1)

This lab session will introduce the datasets used in the course and provide a refresher of statistical concepts and Stata software syntax.

Learning outcomes: L02, L06, L08
learning_activities.topic_description: Lab session (Week 1) This lab session will introduce the datasets used in the course and provide a refresher of statistical concepts and Stata software syntax.

learning_activities.topic:
Revision of statistical concepts (Week 2)

This lecture will provide a revision of key ideas concerning the logic of quantitative research, the properties of quantitative data, bivariate data analyses, and foundational notions in statistical inference. This is a refresher on/summary of material covered in 'SOCY2339 Introducing Quantitative Research'.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03
learning_activities.topic_description: Revision of statistical concepts (Week 2) This lecture will provide a revision of key ideas concerning the logic of quantitative research, the properties of quantitative data, bivariate data analyses, and foundational notions in statistical inference. This is a refresher on/summary of material covered in 'SOCY2339 Introducing Quantitative Research'.

learning_activities.topic:
Lab session (Week 2)

This lab session will cover Stata commands to implement statistical inference for bivariate associations (correlation, chi-squared tests, and t-tests).

Learning outcomes: L04, L08
learning_activities.topic_description: Lab session (Week 2) This lab session will cover Stata commands to implement statistical inference for bivariate associations (correlation, chi-squared tests, and t-tests).

learning_activities.topic:
Index and scale construction (Week 3)

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03
learning_activities.topic_description: Index and scale construction (Week 3)

learning_activities.topic:
Lab session (Week 3)

This session will introduce techniques for index construction using Stata

Learning outcomes: L06, L07, L08
learning_activities.topic_description: Lab session (Week 3) This session will introduce techniques for index construction using Stata

learning_activities.topic:
Introduction to regression (Week 4)

Learning outcomes: L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Introduction to regression (Week 4)

learning_activities.topic:
Lab session (Week 4)

This lab session will provide hands-on practice using multiple linear regression. Students will use Stata software to plot bivariate scatterplots.
learning_activities.topic_description: Lab session (Week 4) This lab session will provide hands-on practice using multiple linear regression. Students will use Stata software to plot bivariate scatterplots.

learning_activities.topic:
Fundamentals of bivariate and multiple linear regression (Week 5)

Learning outcomes: L05
learning_activities.topic_title: Fundamentals of bivariate and multiple linear regression (Week 5)
learning_activities.topic_description: Fundamentals of bivariate and multiple linear regression (Week 5)

learning_activities.topic:
Lab session (Week 5)

Students will continue using Stata to estimate bivariate linear regression.

Learning outcomes: L06, L07, L08, L10
learning_activities.topic_description: Lab session (Week 5) Students will continue using Stata to estimate bivariate linear regression.

learning_activities.topic:
Incorporating categorical predictors in linear regression (Week 6)

Learning outcomes: L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Incorporating categorical predictors in linear regression (Week 6)

learning_activities.topic:
Lab session (Week 6)

Students will fit and interpret multiple regression models in Stata

Learning outcomes: L06, L07, L08
learning_activities.topic_description: Lab session (Week 6) Students will fit and interpret multiple regression models in Stata

learning_activities.topic:
Statistical moderation (Week 7)

Learning outcomes: L04, L05, L10
learning_activities.topic_description: Statistical moderation (Week 7)

learning_activities.topic:
Lab session (Week 7)

This lab session will consist of Stata-based exercises using multiple linear regression.

Learning outcomes: L06, L07, L08
learning_activities.topic_description: Lab session (Week 7) This lab session will consist of Stata-based exercises using multiple linear regression.

learning_activities.topic:

Learning outcomes: L02, L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Statistical mediation (Week 8)

learning_activities.topic:
Lab session (Week 8)

This lab session will involve Stata-based exercises illustrating the logics of moderation and using it in regression models.

Learning outcomes: L06, L07, L08, L10
learning_activities.topic_description: Lab session (Week 8) This lab session will involve Stata-based exercises illustrating the logics of moderation and using it in regression models.

This lab session will involve Stata-based exercises using mediation

Learning outcomes: L06, L07, L08, L10

Lab session (Week 10)

This lab session will involve Stata-based exercises in which students learn how to fit non-linear regression models.

Advanced techniques and external reviews (Week 12)

Learning outcomes: L03, L04, L05, L10
learning_activities.topic_description: Advanced techniques and external reviews (Week 12)

Lab session (Week 12)

In this lab session, students will practice fitting models with ordered and multinomial outcome variables.

Learning outcomes: L06, L07, L08, L09
learning_activities.topic_description: Lab session (Week 12) In this lab session, students will practice fitting models with ordered and multinomial outcome variables.

learning_activities.topic:
Quantitative research showcase (Week 13)

This session will offer students the opportunity to learn about quantitative research projects undertaken by students of Social Science at UQ. Several current and former post-graduate students and research fellows will present findings from their own research and share their experiences with using quantitative research techniques for the analysis of Social Science data.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L10
learning_activities.topic_description: Quantitative research showcase (Week 13) This session will offer students the opportunity to learn about quantitative research projects undertaken by students of Social Science at UQ. Several current and former post-graduate students and research fellows will present findings from their own research and share their experiences with using quantitative research techniques for the analysis of Social Science data.
